title: 60's Album Cover Fonts
content:
Looking for the title and the artist fonts...THANKS as always.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150326195451im_/http:/typophile.com/files/$_57-1_5750.JPG)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [$\_57-1.JPG](http://web.archive.org/web/20150326195451/http:/typophile.com/files/$_57-1.JPG) | 290.85 KB |
author: matango07030

comments.content:
Can't find something close.  
The overall style of "LITTLE JIMMY DICKENS" is a bit close to **[Aachen (Bold)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150326195451/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Letraset%20%2F%20%28Commercial%29&ffam=Aachen%20Com%20-%20Bold&fid=a0e3ac292c549ee27408497d562fbf03&fsize=60&text=LITTLE%20JIMMY%20DICKENS&wrap=2)**  
Here is a perspective corrected sample to make things a bit easier:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150326195451im_/http:/typophile.com/files/may-the-birds_3773.jpg)

The concave style in \_MAY THE BIRD...\_ may not have made it into the digital era.  
The closest digital for the bottom three quarters could be Fredericksburg NF, an interpretation of the 19th century design called "Teutonic"

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150326195451im_/http:/typophile.com/files/FredericksburgNFAsMaySM_5548.jpg)
  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/fredericksburg-wbw/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150326195451/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/fredericksburg-wbw/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/fredericksburg-wbw/") The top quarter is a "wanted poster" reverse contrast style as shown in many "wild west fonts" such as Buffalo Western 
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150326195451im_/http:/typophile.com/files/BuffaloWesternasMAY_4327.jpg)
  [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/kustomtype/buffalo-western/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150326195451/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/kustomtype/buffalo-western/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/kustomtype/buffalo-western/")  
Don

More in the "wanted poster" reverse contrast style, sometimes called French Clarendon or Italienne:  
Westside [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/westside/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150326195451/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/westside/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/westside/")  
PL Barnum Block [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/atbarnum-block/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150326195451/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/atbarnum-block/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/atbarnum-block/")  
Wood Factory [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/kustomtype/wood-factory/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150326195451/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/kustomtype/wood-factory/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/kustomtype/wood-factory/")  
Clarendon Heavy [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/woodentypefonts/clarendon/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150326195451/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/woodentypefonts/clarendon/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/woodentypefonts/clarendon/")  
Playbill [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/playbill/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150326195451/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/playbill/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/playbill/")  
Old Town No 536  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/old-towne-no-536/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150326195451/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/old-towne-no-536/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/old-towne-no-536/")  
Don

"Little Jimmy..." looks octagonal/collegiate in style. One example (still not black enough, though): [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/octin-sports/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150326195451/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/octin-sports/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/octin-sports/")

'MAY THE BIRD...': completely new to me this one; a cross-genre French Clarendon/Italienne x Tuscan Concave; couldn't find anything similar; best option would be what Don said: start with 'Teutonic' (another version [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20150326195451/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/woodentypefonts/teutonic)) and add large fat top serifs; you could also do it the other way round and starting from a Tuscan Concave Slab like [Number 154](http://web.archive.org/web/20150326195451/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/woodentypefonts/number-154) reworking all bottoms;  
'LITTLE JIMMY DICKENS': interesting digital alternative with Sergiy Tkachenko's [Sports World](http://web.archive.org/web/20150326195451/http:/www.behance.net/gallery/3373761/Sports-World-(Typeface)) of 4th February;
Thanks for the help and advice...!!
